chooser
Class FrameChooser

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      chooser.FrameChooser
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class FrameChooser
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

When launched, FrameChooser displays a JFrame providing several choices to a user through JComboBoxes. The JFrame contains three buttons, one to quit the application, one to display in another JFrame the result of the choices, one to hide the JFrame presenting the result (hidden by default)

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

FrameChooser

public FrameChooser(int k,
                    java.lang.String t)
Constructs a FrameChooser with title t and k JComboBox

Parameters:
k - number of JComboBox displayed in the main JFrame
t - title to be put in a JLabel on top of the main JFrame
Method Detail

addChoicesList

public void addChoicesList(java.lang.String[] list)
Adds the data to be placed in a JComboBox. This method has to be called a number of times equal to the number of JComboBox of the main JFrame

Parameters:
list - list of information to be chosen among in the current comboBox

bg - background color of the result frame
